title: Who Owned the Media in 2011

author.bio: Considering whether to delete my account. Decided to just set my profile private for now.
author.bio_html: Considering whether to delete my account. Decided to just set my profile private for now.

body:
I truly have no idea how this infographic is defining "the Media."

It talks about television (both news and non-news) and newspapers - ABC, Jeopardy, and the Wall Street Journal. Even Marvel Studios is in there for some reason.

But there's absolutely no mention of streaming in it. Netflix, Hulu, Twitch, YouTube - no mention of any of it. Streaming media is almost 25% of all television usage, and growing every year.

So apparently that's not media?

Radio? No mention. Blogs? No mention. News magazines and long form journalism? No mention.

55% of adults say they get most of their news from social media. Are Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, Instagram anywhere on this list? Nope.
body_html:
I truly have no idea how this infographic is defining "the Media."

It talks about television (both news and non-news) and newspapers - ABC, Jeopardy, and the Wall Street Journal. Even Marvel Studios is in there for some reason.

But there's absolutely no mention of streaming in it. Netflix, Hulu, Twitch, YouTube - no mention of any of it. Streaming media is almost 25% of all television usage, and growing every year.

So apparently that's not media?

Radio? No mention. Blogs? No mention. News magazines and long form journalism? No mention.

55% of adults say they get most of their news from social media. Are Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, Instagram anywhere on this list? Nope.

body:
I haven't looked up the leaders or founders yet.  If what you imply is true, I'd guess education would be one of the top reasons. If what you imply is true, maybe that good ole boy network is also part of the reason. People always envision the racist Southern man when they hear good ole boy, but many fields have such a network and they control or influence who does and doesn't get in or climb too high in the ranks.
In the case of businesses, though, the customer *can* control if that company lives or dies.

post.title: Who Owned the Media in 2011

body:
This chart is pretty much correct for 2011:

* Hulu was owned by Comcast and AT&T iirc so it's not relevant, it would just be another listing under one of the existing.
* Netflix in 2011 simply streamed content produced by one of the mentioned providers. They had not broken into original content yet
* Youtube was not as big in 2011 as it is now and did not have Youtube Red/Premium original content.
* Twitch literally just debuted in 2011 so it would not even be relevant at that time

Also overall streaming wasn't really that big in 2011. Hell I believe Netflix still offered the DVD rental service itself back then (It's DVD.com now) and not everything in their library *was* available for stream, and Hulu still had the free tier. On top of that I don't think this chart was intended to include user generated content so that excludes Twitch period and Youtube in 2011 terms (since they did get into original content later on).
body_html:
This chart is pretty much correct for 2011:

  • Hulu was owned by Comcast and AT&T iirc so it's not relevant, it would just be another listing under one of the existing.
  • Netflix in 2011 simply streamed content produced by one of the mentioned providers. They had not broken into original content yet
  • Youtube was not as big in 2011 as it is now and did not have Youtube Red/Premium original content.
  • Twitch literally just debuted in 2011 so it would not even be relevant at that time

Also overall streaming wasn't really that big in 2011. Hell I believe Netflix still offered the DVD rental service itself back then (It's DVD.com now) and not everything in their library was available for stream, and Hulu still had the free tier. On top of that I don't think this chart was intended to include user generated content so that excludes Twitch period and Youtube in 2011 terms (since they did get into original content later on).

author.ban_reason: Threats and harassment of other users is not allowed. Unmarked NSFL content is not allowed.

body:
Disney was founded in 1923 by Walt Disney who died in 1966.  
Shortly after Roy Disney took over until 1971, followed by Donn Tatum and Card Walker until 1984.  - During this time, the movies "Sleeping beauty"; "Peter Pan"; "Snow White" and "Lady and the Tramp" were produced.  

In 1984, a takeover began. Zionist and investor ✡Stanley Gold✡ took over Disney with ✡Michael Eisner✡ as CEO. - Now the movies changed in style. We get more diverse movies such as: 'Beauty and the beast'; 'Pocahontas'; 'Heavyweights'; 'Alladin' and so on.  In 1991 in Walt Disney World near Orlando, Florida the so-called "Gay Days at Walt Disney World" is introduced.

In 1995, ✡Michael Ovitz✡ became president of disney until 2000, where ✡Rob Iger✡ became the new president.

------------

Meanwhile, CBS is owned by ✡Sumner Rothstein✡ with CEO ✡Les Moonves✡.  

CNN by ✡David Levy✡ and ✡Jeff Zucker✡  

Viacom is also under control of ✡Sumner Rothstein✡

Warner Media was founded by ✡Steve Ross✡ and the Warner Bros president is ✡Peter Roth✡ 

Comcast is controlled by CEO ✡Brian L. Roberts✡
body_html:
Disney was founded in 1923 by Walt Disney who died in 1966.
Shortly after Roy Disney took over until 1971, followed by Donn Tatum and Card Walker until 1984. - During this time, the movies "Sleeping beauty"; "Peter Pan"; "Snow White" and "Lady and the Tramp" were produced.

In 1984, a takeover began. Zionist and investor ✡Stanley Gold✡ took over Disney with ✡Michael Eisner✡ as CEO. - Now the movies changed in style. We get more diverse movies such as: 'Beauty and the beast'; 'Pocahontas'; 'Heavyweights'; 'Alladin' and so on. In 1991 in Walt Disney World near Orlando, Florida the so-called "Gay Days at Walt Disney World" is introduced.

In 1995, ✡Michael Ovitz✡ became president of disney until 2000, where ✡Rob Iger✡ became the new president.

Meanwhile, CBS is owned by ✡Sumner Rothstein✡ with CEO ✡Les Moonves✡.

CNN by ✡David Levy✡ and ✡Jeff Zucker✡

Viacom is also under control of ✡Sumner Rothstein✡

Warner Media was founded by ✡Steve Ross✡ and the Warner Bros president is ✡Peter Roth✡

Comcast is controlled by CEO ✡Brian L. Roberts✡

body:
wow, Roberts' mother must be a jew.  I would never suspect a Roberts of being Jewish.
AS for the diversity of Disney - I am fine with a level of diversity.  My problem is sometimes the *ratio*...if 85% of Americans are white, then we don't need 70% of our media to be dominated by other races.  I do think we need more minorities in media, but those they chose are either gay, or extremely liberal.  There are enough Hispanic or East Asian or Indian people who are rather Conservative or middle-ground or Independent (not too liberal) who would like positions in the media or acting or as singers. I am very grossed out by how many very 'affected' (flaming!) gay men are in the modeling industry.  Those men try to make women look like drag queens and the gay male models do *not* represent middle America.  There are often some really gorgeous East Asian models who are masculine and straight, yet those who hire pick the effeminate and/or gay ones who aren't quite as attractive.  There is an agenda being pushed on us and that is what I resent.
If I can accept a sliver more of diversity but someone tells me I must have the entire pie of diversity slammed in my face, then I might get so turned off that I reject it completely.
I've marched in 2 gay pride parades, but when I began seeing how pushy the agenda was, I stopped advocating for them.  I will have no group shove something down my throat (not even the groups I might fall under). I am *not* at *all* a right-winger or Conservative.  I am a party of *one* (what I think at the moment) and I don't play that 'mah team', 'mah party', 'mah side' crap.
FYI: I am an atheist and have asked a few J-atheists (Jewish atheists) how the feel about IsraEl receiving money from the US government and they are okay with hat.  I am not. I write IsraEl to make the two words that are combined into one stand out:  it means God's Promise or something similar....El  means god. So, IsraEl is a religious state, so it seems like utter nonsense to me for an atheist to want money to go to it yet they think (and I agree) that churches should get no tax breaks or government money.  It is hypocrisy to me. I *like* those J-atheists I spoke to about this and they were very pleasant, but I disagree about the topic. I also don't like the dual-citizenship thing, but that is open to anyone of any back ground. I find dual citizenship extremely divisive.  You're either loyal to America or you aren't!

My problem is sometimes the ratio...if 85% of Americans are white, then we don't need 70% of our media to be dominated by other races. I do think we need more minorities in media, but those they chose are either gay, or extremely liberal. There are enough Hispanic or East Asian or Indian people who are rather Conservative or middle-ground or Independent (not too liberal) who would like positions in the media or acting or as singers. I am very grossed out by how many very 'affected' (flaming!) gay men are in the modeling industry. Those men try to make women look like drag queens and the gay male models do not represent middle America. There are often some really gorgeous East Asian models who are masculine and straight, yet those who hire pick the effeminate and/or gay ones who aren't quite as attractive. There is an agenda being pushed on us and that is what I resent. If I can accept a sliver more of diversity but someone tells me I must have the entire pie of diversity slammed in my face, then I might get so turned off that I reject it completely. I've marched in 2 gay pride parades, but when I began seeing how pushy the agenda was, I stopped advocating for them. I will have no group shove something down my throat (not even the groups I might fall under). I am not at all a right-winger or Conservative. I am a party of one (what I think at the moment) and I don't play that 'mah team', 'mah party', 'mah side' crap. FYI: I am an atheist and have asked a few J-atheists (Jewish atheists) how the feel about IsraEl receiving money from the US government and they are okay with hat. I am not. I write IsraEl to make the two words that are combined into one stand out: it means God's Promise or something similar....El means god. So, IsraEl is a religious state, so it seems like utter nonsense to me for an atheist to want money to go to it yet they think (and I agree) that churches should get no tax breaks or government money.
